comment: He is awesome. Extremely helpful and clear. Overall pretty easy class.

He waited until after the add-drop period to post the first test grade, which most the class did poorly on. No homework is due until the end of the semester, four tests and he doesn't drop the lowest. He speaks in rhetorical questions.
He makes the math understandable, and is super cute. I never opened the text book, but I did any learning I needed to do on MyMathLab. Really good teacher and makes math easy

He is entertaining, really easy to talk to and makes sure everyone understands. You can skip the final if you want and no homework is neccessary but it helped me study, he doesnt grade anything but the test! great teacher, TAKE HIM! btw super hot

No textbook- just mymathlab & he does not grade the homework assignments or even check them. Three tests & a final but he told us if we were happy with our grade we could exempt the final. Young teacher, kind of talks to you like you are in elementary school, but hey I made an A and I hate math. Definitely take him!
Cool dude. Young and chill. Easy to talk to. Great teacher.

I love this professor. Your grades consisted of three tests and a final. He was very straight forward and willing to help you. He always had a class to review before the test which helps a lot. I definitely recommend him!

He does talk down to students a little, but only because he's like 25 and thinks he has to. He's a really nice guy, class isn't mandatory, hmwk isn't mandatory, but you HAVE to show work on tests. He'll give you credit for writing out your work even if you get the problem wrong. But it's worth it to go to class just to look at him!

Professor Hippchen is a great teacher.  He does a good job of explaining the material in an easy to understand way.  The book is not required.  Homework is not mandatory. Your grade is based on 4 tests that are ~10 questions each.  If you pay attention in class and review the MyMathLab online before the tests you will do fine.

Easy class. Make sure to show work on tests the way he wants it or minimal credit. We didn't touch the textbook. Save your money. He does talk to us like we are in elementary school, but you don't have to go to class. For our class the final wasn't mandatory if you were happy with your average, so do well on tests if you don't want to take it.

Hippchen is a really great teacher. He kinda talks to everyone like they're in 5th grade, but he explains everythingvery clearly. He gives tons of examples. I didn't go to 1/3 of the classes and I didn't buy the text book or the online book and I have a 3.4 out of 4.0 going into the final. It's a really easy class as long as you show up.
He is very chill and laid back. Explains the subject very well and if you ask questions he answers them and helps until you understand it. What more can you ask for? weird grading style

He is a cool teacher, but he talks to the class like were in pre k, but he does make sure everything is explained. He does not post grades online, and has a weird grading system for tests. He does not check the homework, so you do not have to buy the online math key unless you want it for extra help. Class consists of 3 test grades and a final.
This guy is AWESOME! By far the best professor I've had. He's a cool guy. Not intimidating at all. Really laid back too. DEFINITELY take him if you can!

The dude talks to the class like we are in the third grade. He doesn't post any grades online. You have to completely work the problem out and then plug in your answer and work it out again. Doesn't like if you just right down the answer. He will not give you credit.

Thomas is a wonderful professor! Notes are very clear as well as what is expected in the class. If you miss a class he will give you copied notes from the previous class. Attendance is taken, but not required. If you do you do not understand the material he will take the time to make sure you understand. Take him if you have the opportunity!

This guy *gets* teaching. Understanding first, terminology later. He'll make combinatorics crystal-clear to you without ever tossing around a five-dollar word like combinatorics. Plus, he's actually a cool guy -- he's younger and isn't quite as stiff as other professors. Knows all students by name and is willing to give one-on-one help when needed.

Professor was nice to the point.  He does make you work problems out rather than depending on the calculator heavily.  This is a remedial class so that is the best way to do it.  Too many students use calculators and don't know how to actually work problems.  I liked him and found the class very easy.
Okay....he likes to make you work all math problems by hand vs showing you the quick calculator method. Difficult for the heck of it...not to cool.
Pretty easy class. He's a really intersting guy and grades tests fair. He's pretty good at teaching too:)

By far the best math teacher i've ever had. Very good at explaining and helping you understand the concepts. If you're not good at math like me and need someone to really help u, TAKE HIM! U have to buy a $75 online thing but the book is optional. Takes attendance but it doesn't count against u. HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIM!

Definitely my favorite class of the semester. It got boring at times during each day but notes go fast, so you have to pay attention. He will answer any questions and attendance is only for extra credit. Tests are fairly easy, some people had trouble but I never made under a 90. Overall really cool and awesome guy. Highly recommend him.

Thomas is a great teacher. After being out of school for many years, he taught me things that I never learned in school and new ways to do algebra. Made math fun and I remembered why I loved math. Does teach fast, but will answer any questions.

Thomas was a very nice teacher, related well with the students. His teaching style is a little different from some of the other math teachers. You either did well, or you didn't. If you are not good at studying and picking things up on your own, he is not going to be a good fit for you.
Wonderful teacher.  Really teaches in a way that is easy to learn.  Take him.  You will not regret it.

He is so helpful and I thought that he taught at a steady pace. He reminded me of a Noah Callhoun but rough around the edges.: ) Seriously, he will slow down and back up if you need help.I recommend him.
Thomas is a excellent teacher (sweet,young and good humor).  Very down to earth and helpful.  He does teach the class to fast, so if you are NOT good with algebra(think twice).
